page.title: 02 Chartham Hatch Village
page.content: We entered Chartham Hatch along Bigbury Road.Suddenly we came out of the woodland into a row of bungalows.It was sudden because the first dwellings almost merge with the woods with many trees towering above them.Had it not been for the fact that we had just driven gingerly along the narrow wooded lane we might have been in any town or city as we looked at the first houses about us which were some square blocks of four terraced houses.There were the cars, the motorbikes, the telegraph poles and TV aerials of the towns and cities.But the gardens were all more alive and better tended than many town gardens. A jogger went by, certainly a symbol of the health conscious eighties.He was no doubt a university student, whose original home must have been in the Middle East.
